data.title: Great lil place!!
data.text: The food is homemade and delicious. Great bar area but still family friendly! It's the best of both worlds! Daily and nightly specials. Love it! Best place in town and the staff is friendly and knowledgeable!! Good times to be had by all and great eats and drinks!

data.title: Great Burgers!
data.text: When I say great I mean it two ways.  First every one of them on the menu are huge -- l'm a good eater and to take half of mine home.  Secondly,  they are well prepared with all the fixins. Menu has a wide variety to choose from -- I took some time to select &;went with BBQ.  Also had crab-stuffed mushrooms & onion rings -- both very good.  Put your diet & health foods aside & go here -- you'll enjoy it!

data.title: Great place to meet with friends!
data.text: Three of us visited on a Wednesday night, we had different beers and meals. One had wings, another pizza and I had a 1/2 lb. burger and fries. It was all good and the staff was fun and attentive, without being in our way during conversations. This was my first visit and definitely not my last.

data.title: Unexpectedly good.
data.text: This place doesn't look too great from the outside and looks a bit basic on the inside. The staff were knowledgeable, friendly and efficient and the food was good. Glad we stopped by!

data.title: Baron Burger
data.text:
I have been to both Baron's. My grown son says they have the best Burgers around! And I agree. They also have delicious French fries! And they have specials most days.
They are a good place to eat with good food, good service, and reasonable prices!

data.title: Great Pub
data.text: We were in Suffolk for one night while traveling and wanted to go to a casual good restaurant. We found it at Barons.  We had 3 different meals, all of them very good. The atmosphere was casual, the staff was friendly and efficient.  Good selection of beer too!  We will stop again if we are in the area.

data.title: Excellent Service
data.text: Half priced apps for Happy Hour!! Great food and even better atmosphere. Taco Tuesdays - Baron Burger Wednesdays........the list goes on.  Separate bar & dining area.

data.title: Casual food
data.text: Could use some updating. Suitable for casual dining only. Food is OK but not spectacular. Prices are fair considering the amount of food being served.

data.title: Great Service
data.text: Was greeted and seated very quickly. Our server, Alex, was awesome. She was quick, professional, and very nice. The food was pretty good. I had the clam chowder and BBQ sandwich. Everything was tasty. Alex kept checking on us and making sure our drinks were filled. Glad we had dinner here.

data.title: Nice place downtown
data.text:
My wife and I stopped in for a quick dinner.  It is aptly named a pub.  Lots of wood on the interior, tables up front, and a bar in the back.  I would take kids in for lunch or an early dinner, but most places like this turn into more of a bar as the evening wears on.  The place is cozy, and I can see how  it might get loud if it is crowded.  Fortunately, it was only about 40% occupied when we walked in at 7.

Service was prompt and knowledgeable.  The patrons were friendly and helpful with their advice about the menu.

I had the steak sandwich, which was very good.  Served on french bread with real hand cut fries.  8/10. My wife had the Cajun shrimp appetizer and a house salad.  All very good.  The locals raved about the scallops.

The price was very reasonable.  The only negative is that this place is downtown, and a different element roams the streets after normal business hours.  It could get iffy walking back to your car after dark, especially since the pub has to rely on street parking or the church lot across the street.

I would go back if I am ever in Suffolk at mealtime.

data.title: Fun place
data.text:
Full house mid-week evening, so popular.  Younger crowd so noise level is high.  
Our food was good to average.   Wine choices seem poor as they cater to a different crowd.  Child friendly and service was great despite the crowd.  Prices are moderate for a family.  You can share a large pizza.  The grilled chicken salad is good.

data.title: Will NOT return
data.text: First, I was returning from a previous trip that did not go well.  So, this was round 2!   After ordering it took 25 mins to get our appetizer.  The Mile High Nachos had way too much lettuce.  Halfway thru we noticed that they forgot to put on the Beef!  Waitress forgot that we ordered onion rings, my Godfather burger had no marinara sauce, and my wife's French Dip was the worst she ever tasted.  So all together I will not give them a chance with a 3rd strike.  I will NOT be back!

data.title: Grilled Chicken Salad
data.text: I wandered in this Pub while passing through town.  The wait staff was responsive and helpful.  As I was by self I people watched, the people surrounding me were all in good spirits and being attended to.  I remarked how the poor wait staff had to go up and down a series of steps with everything.  That takes a certain finesse and I commended the for it.  I ordered the grilled chicken salad with the honey mustard.  The mixture of different lettuce greens, shaved carrots cucumbers, cherry tomatoes and green and red peppers made the vegetable portion of this salad a treat.  The best part was the home made croutons and honeymustard dressing that was so thick that it stuck like a paste to all the ingredients it touched.  The grilled chicken was flavorful and juicy.  It was a meal that made for a delicious lunch in a fun and unique atmosphere during a Sunday Lunch!

data.title: Get the Baron Burger
data.text: It started in downtown Portsmouth as a pub and now the second and more upscale location in the heart of old downtown Suffolk.  We always went on burger days but it has other good specials like fried chicken and a great menu.  We usually stop by the Suffolk location when in town, plus, the Planters Peanut Store and the Facility are just around the corner.   Look for the Mr. Peanut's on the fence posts.

data.title: Good food
data.text: Not a big menu to choose from. Took awhile to get our drinks and food. Seemed the waitress would rather talk to her friends than ask what we wanted to drink or order. Food was average. Too crowded and on top of each other.

data.title: Good Place
data.text: We stopped in for a quick lunch and were not disappointed.  The menu is extensive for both food and drinks.  There are plenty of TV's and the staff is happy to change channels.

data.title: Best Burgers
data.text: The homemade fries are amazing.  Service is top rate. Probably one of the best burgers I have ever had.  I have been there twice this month and the second time Reuben was equally scrumptious.

data.title: Love Baron's Pub!
data.text: If want good food in a pub atmosphere, Baron's is your place. From their signature Baron Burger, to Steamed Shrimp Thursday's, you be hard pressed to find something you don't like at Baron's!

data.title: Best Burgers
data.text: Today I went out on a limb and tried the Peanut City burger.  Well worth the extravagant calorie count!  Half pound burger topped with peanut butter,  bacon,  provolone, lettuce and tomato.  Could only eat half but was assured the other half will reheat well. The peanut butter sounds very odd for a burger but it is delicious and different.  The side of fries was luke warm.  They had good flavor but just not hot.

data.title: Burgers for Lunch
data.text: Came strictly for the burgers.  Special on Wednesdays is the Baron Burger for $5 however I decided on the Black and Blue burger for slightly more.  Beef taste was wonderful, Gorgonzola cheese was tasty, Cajun slices were not over powering.  Side of onion rings were good. Service was prompt and attentive.  Baron's burgers beat out all the chain burgers and most all off the locally owned places burger's.  Try them, you won't be disappointed.
